column4: no root pw? what if someone tries to ssh into your computer as root?
error processing kernel-headers-2.4.27-2-686_2.4.27-12_i386.deb package architecture (i386) does not match system (amd64)
man, i guess i'm not using ubuntu
until it gets updated to use an up-to-date kernel
because this is an absolute pain and i've been working on it for 13 hours straight
you have to install amd64 headers on an amd64 system
sure there are, I have a 386 system but I see the package in my list
i looked through and i don't see any amd64 dapper .deb
ok, that's possible, if I use unreleased software I don't bitch about it not being finished
then how do i get it running
why do you need dapper?  use breezy
if you need a 2.4 kernel, don't use ubuntu
slackware still ships with a 2.4 kernel, as does one of the debian flavors
jesus dude breezy doesn't have the ethernet driver i need
sounds like you really aren't a good candidate for ubuntu
